channel.title: Synesthesia on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Synesthesia on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: assisted synesthesia as augmented reality
item.description: A comment I wrote on Ethan Hein's account of color-coding sequencer tracks: When you say “color coding improved your ears”, the first thing that comes to mind is that you are doing some kind of machine-assisted synesthesia. very cool, that. another enticing pice from oblong industries It's true that one of the elements is a blue ball that bounces in time to the music and touches down on the notes that are playing just then.
